title: With 27 leaf-litter bins, this  neighbourhood in Chennai was ready for Cyclone Ditwah
description: After Ditwah retreats and the gust ceases, the fallen leaves on five streets in Kotturpuram will not leave those streets, but be deposited in 27 leaf litter bins and allowed to turn into compost. A gardener would water the leaf litter periodically to aid the composting process. When the compost is ready, it will be  distributed to residents, who will use it for their plants thereby closing the loop

title: ‘Cosmic Creepy-Crawly’: Nasa unveils new Red Spider Nebula image; reveals new details

Scientists are also seeing the full extent of the nebula's 'legs' and a fast-moving jet carving its intricate structure, offering fresh insights into stellar death.

description: Delhi Police has registered a fresh FIR against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, along with six others, for allegedly fraudulently acquiring Associated Journals Ltd. The acquisition, valued at Rs 2,000 crore, was made through Young Indian, in which the Gandhis hold a majority stake. This FIR stems from the ED's money laundering probe.

title: Tejas: Vital vanguard
description: Despite the Dubai crash, HAL and the IAF remain firm that the fighter aircraft is safe, reliable and strategically crucial for India’s air combat capability

description: Food is a diary in disguise, with each dish becoming a chapter, and every bite a bookmark

Bhiwani wedding: Bodybuilder dies after attack for confronting men harassing women
description: A 26-year-old Rohtak bodybuilder, Rohit Dhankhar, tragically died after confronting men harassing women at a wedding in Bhiwani. Ambushed by approximately 20 assailants armed with weapons, Rohit was brutally beaten when he and his friend stopped at a railway crossing. Despite efforts by doctors, he succumbed to his severe injuries.

title: Pakistan cancelled military action against Afghanistan at Qatar's request: DPM Dar
description: Ishaq Dar warned that Pakistan has the power and capability to fix the issues of militancy emanating from Afghanistan.

title: Bengaluru school students create award-winning app for faster ambulance access
description: ‘Ambulink’ developed by Grade 8 students from Bengaluru has won the Global Grand Prize at Technovation Girls 2025, one of the world’s largest tech-entrepreneurship competitions to encourage girls to pursue STEM

title: German far-right party sets up its new youth wing as thousands protest
The Durand Line: Fragile frontier
description: The colonial-era boundary, which Afghanistan doesn’t recognise today, remains a source of contention between Kabul and Islamabad

title: Canada-returned woman arrested for husband’s murder
description: A woman, Rupinder Kaur, recently returned from Canada, has been arrested for allegedly conspiring with her paramour, Harkanwalpreet Singh, to murder her husband, Gurwinder Singh, in Faridkot. The victim's sister alleged Rupinder had suspicions about her wife's character and a possible affair. Investigations are underway regarding their Canadian connections.

title: MCD bypolls today; BJP, AAP, Cong. to face off first time after Feb. 5 election
description: Polling to 12 wards to begin from 7.30 a.m.; enhanced transport and security in place across 580 booths; police to deploy drones to monitor three booths marked ‘critical’

title: 50 years after her rape changed law, ‘Mathura’ lives in hunger
description: Decades after her rape in a police station sparked legal reforms, 'Mathura' now lives in poverty, paralyzed and unvisited. Her ordeal led to crucial changes in India's sexual assault laws, yet she remains excluded from welfare schemes due to her inability to navigate digital systems. Her story highlights the enduring gap between legal progress and individual justice.

title: Justice Surya Kant: Striking a balance in a divided nation
description: The new Chief Justice of India, who will serve until February 2027, believes that justice is not merely about resolving disputes, but about ‘protecting the innocent from being lost in the storms of circumstance’

title: Whispers of ink and iron
description: There was a time, many moons ago, when the clatter of keys striking paper echoed through quiet rooms, a sound as familiar as the ticking of a clock

Vasant Vihar ‘suicide’ case: Woman faced years of abuse; FIR details assault
description: An industrialist's daughter-in-law allegedly faced prolonged mental and physical abuse, isolation, and defamation before her death. Her mother, who has demanded a CBI probe, detailed incidents of assault during pregnancy and her husband's extramarital affair. The abuse reportedly resumed after a period of stability, culminating in a confrontation over obscene content on a phone.

Revolutionising home-food preservation, one jar at a time
description: On November 30, 1858, American tinkerer John Landis Mason received a patent for what went on to be the Mason jar. Even though Mason never gained personally from it, the jar that bears his name revolutionised home-food preservation. A.S.Ganesh hands you a jar full of details…

title: Ask AI, but show your prompts: IIIT-Delhi redefines evaluation
description: IIIT-Delhi is overhauling its evaluation system by allowing AI tools like ChatGPT in exams and assignments. Students will be required to submit their prompts, shifting focus to prompt quality, reasoning, and analysis. This move aims to integrate AI responsibly into education and prepare students for evolving learning patterns.

He and Swift recently had a four-hour catch-up, highlighting their deep, effortless friendship that transcends digital updates.

Vanessa Bryant enjoys Disneyland day as her daughters steal the spotlight
description: Vanessa Bryant recently shared a heartwarming glimpse of a Disneyland outing with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri on Instagram. The philanthropist has been a steadfast presence for her girls, balancing their needs with her own grief. Bryant expressed immense pride in Natalia's resilience and maturity, highlighting her role as a supportive big sister and daughter.

title: 'This is Virat, mayday': Ukraine 'claims' strike on two Russian oil tankers
description: A Russian oil tanker, the Virat, was struck by an unmanned vessel in the Black Sea near the Turkish coast, with explosions reported. Another vessel, the Kairos, also experienced an explosion. In footage of a crew member aboard Virat, a man reports it to be a drone attack in panic. Ukrainian sources have claimed responsibility, stating they targeted the ships for allegedly transporting sanctioned Russian oil.

Anthony Albanese marries Haydon; first Australian PM wedding in 124 yrs - pics
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese married his partner Jodie Haydon in a private ceremony at The Lodge in Canberra, becoming the first sitting leader to do so in the nation's federal history. Around 60 close family and friends attended the civil wedding, with their dog Toto as ring bearer. The couple expressed delight in sharing their commitment with loved ones.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: ‘Mobile not allowed in school’: Class 8 student, national level skater jumps from MP school
description: A 14-year-old national-level skater in Ujjain tragically jumped from his school's third floor after being summoned to discuss his mobile phone use. The boy, who sustained severe injuries including spinal fractures, reportedly feared his parents' reaction. He was preparing for a national tournament. An investigation is underway.

title: Bo Bichette contract talks pause amid major risks for Toronto Blue Jays
description: MLB analysts are questioning the Toronto Blue Jays' delay in re-signing star Bo Bichette, especially after the team's significant investment in pitcher Dylan Cease. Concerns over Bichette's injury history, including missing substantial time in the 2024 season, are cited as potential reasons for the team's cautious approach to a long-term contract.

title: US tariffs: Mark Carney tells Canadians; Levies will wipe $50 billion from Canada's economy
description: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is rolling back climate rules and encouraging pipeline construction to boost the energy sector amidst US tariff uncertainty. This move aims to diversify oil exports and reduce reliance on the US market, though it sparks internal government tensions and environmentalist criticism.
